people.name: Tim Cook
contributions: Led Apple into new markets like services and wearables

people.name: Jony Ive
contributions: Designed iMac, iPod, iPhone, and Apple Watch

people.name: Phil Schiller
people.role: Senior Vice President of Worldwide Marketing
contributions: Instrumental in launching iPhone and iPad

people.name: Craig Federighi
people.role: Senior Vice President of Software Engineering
contributions: Led development of iOS and macOS
Introduced new software features like FaceTime, iCloud, and Siri

people.name: Eddy Cue
contributions: Oversaw the growth of Apple’s services division including Apple TV+, Apple Arcade, and Apple News+

people.name: Lisa Jackson
people.role: Vice President of Environment, Policy and Social Initiatives
contributions: Led environmental and renewable energy initiatives
Advocated for privacy and social justice

people.name: Jeff Williams
contributions: Oversees operations, supply chain, and customer support

products.name: Apple II
features: First commercially successful personal computer from Apple.
products.impact: Popularized personal computing in homes and schools.

products.name: Macintosh
features: Introduced the graphical user interface (GUI).

products.name: iPhone
features: Combined phone, music player, camera, and internet in one device.

products.name: iPad
features: Hybrid device between a smartphone and a laptop.
products.impact: Created a new category of devices and popularized digital content consumption.

products.name: iPad Pro
features: Large, high-resolution display, powerful processor, support for Apple Pencil

products.name: Mac Pro
features: Modular and expandable design
Professional performance
products.impact: Set a new standard for professional desktop computers.

products.name: iMac G3
features: Transparent and colorful design
First iMac with integrated internet connectivity
products.impact: Revitalized the Apple brand and popularized internet access at home.

products.name: MacBook Air
features: Extremely thin and lightweight
Long battery life
Retina display (introduced in 2018 models)
M1 and M2 chips (introduced in 2020 and 2022 models)
products.impact: Defined the category of ultraportable laptops.

products.name: MacBook Pro
features: High-performance laptop with professional-grade capabilities
Retina display (introduced in 2012 models)
Touch Bar (introduced in 2016 models)
M1 and M2 chips (introduced in 2020 and 2022 models)
Liquid Retina XDR display (introduced in 2021 models)
products.impact: Set the standard for professional-grade laptops with high performance and advanced features.
models: MacBook Pro with M1 Pro and M1 Max chips (2021)
MacBook Pro with M2 Pro and M2 Max chips (2023)

products.name: iPod
features: Ability to store thousands of songs in a portable device.
products.impact: Popularized digital music and laid the groundwork for the iPhone.

products.name: iPod Nano
features: Compact and colorful design
Color display
products.impact: Made the iPod popular among younger audiences.

products.name: Apple Watch
features: Heart rate monitor, notifications, mobile payments

products.name: AirPods
features: Ergonomic design, high-quality sound, instant wireless connection with Apple devices

products.name: Apple TV
features: Streaming of multimedia content to the TV

products.name: HomePod
features: High-quality sound, Siri voice assistant, smart home control
products.impact: Competed with other smart speakers like Amazon Echo and Google Home.
